com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression

Class Grouping

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.Operator
      • com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.Grouping
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Operator>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClosingBracket, OpeningBracket, Vector

    public abstract class Grouping
extends Operator
    Represent a grouping operators

    A grouping operator is an operator with a beginning and an end, within the infix expression, wich encloses an expression. Usually the enclosed expression has priority over the outer expression
    This is a default implementation that models the behaviour of the common brackets

    Author:
    Fabrizio Colonna

      • executeOperation

        public Operand executeOperation(java.util.Stack<Expression> operands)
                         throws ExpressionException
        A grouping operator executes no mathematical operations
        Specified by:
        executeOperation in class Operator
        Parameters:
        operands - A stack containing the operands in reversed order
        Returns:
        It returns a number if the operation succeeded or null to express empty-result
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - The exception is thrown when there is an evaluation problem

      • executeParsing

        public Operator executeParsing(CmplxExpression postfix,
                      java.util.Stack<Operator> opstack)
                        throws ExpressionException
        Execute the parsing operation that the operator may require

        The parsing operation is an operation that is performed when the operator is fetched from the input string
        The default implementation for a grouping operator divides the operation for the opening groping and the closing groping, calling the respective functions

        Overrides:
        executeParsing in class Operator
        Parameters:
        postfix - The full postfix stack, as it is build before the call to this method
        opstack - The full operator stack, as it is constructed before the call to this method
        Returns:
        An instance of the operator to be pushed at the end of the operators stack,
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - The exception is thrown when there is an evaluation problem
        See Also:
        Operator.executeParsing(com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.CmplxExpression, java.util.Stack<com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.Operator>)

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        Gets the absolute priority of the operand

        The priority of an operator is expressed using an Integer, while a priority can only be set using a Short because priorities use levels. For more information see Operator.getPriority()

        Overrides:
        getPriority in class Operator
        Returns:
        A number indicating the priority of the operator

      • isOpening

        public abstract boolean isOpening()
        It indicates if the class represents an opening grouping
        Returns:
        true if the object is an opening grouping

      • setCurrentOperands

        public final void setCurrentOperands(int value)
        Sets the number of operands currently used

        A grouping operator is always a unary operator, so whatever value is given this function will set the currentOperands always to 1.

        Overrides:
        setCurrentOperands in class Operator
        Parameters:
        value - A number indicating how many operands this operator needs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This exception is thrown when a wrong number of current operands is specified

      • setOperandsLimit

        public final void setOperandsLimit(int min,
                    int max)
        Sets the limits of the number of operands allowed for the operator

        A grouping operator is always a unary operator, so whatever value is given this function will set the maximum and minimum are always 1.

        Overrides:
        setOperandsLimit in class Operator
        Parameters:
        min - Minimum number of operand allowed
        max - Maximum number of operand allowed

                             java.util.Stack<Operator> opstack,
                             Context context)
                                  throws ExpressionException
        Execute the parsing operation that the operator may require

        This function is called when an closing grouping is fetched from the input string

        Parameters:
